Interface Strings


  • public interface Strings
    String utility functions.

      Decimal format for floating numbers.

      Returns the string representation of array in format '[1.0, 2.0, 3.0]'."

      Returns the string representation of array in format '[1, 2, 3]'."

      • leftPad

        static java.lang.String leftPad(java.lang.String str,
                                int size,
                                char padChar)
        Left pad a String with a specified character.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to pad out, may be null
        size - the size to pad to
        padChar - the character to pad with
        Returns:
        left padded String or original String if no padding is necessary, null if null String input

      • rightPad

        static java.lang.String rightPad(java.lang.String str,
                                 int size,
                                 char padChar)
        Right pad a String with a specified character.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to pad out, may be null
        size - the size to pad to
        padChar - the character to pad with
        Returns:
        left padded String or original String if no padding is necessary, null if null String input

      • toString

        static java.lang.String toString(float[] a)

      • toString

        static java.lang.String toString(double[] a)
        Returns the string representation of array in format '[1.0, 2.0, 3.0]'."

      • parseIntArray

        static int[] parseIntArray(java.lang.String s)
        Parses a double array in format '[1.0, 2.0, 3.0]'. Returns null if s is null or empty.

      • parseDoubleArray

        static double[] parseDoubleArray(java.lang.String s)
        Parses a double array in format '[1.0, 2.0, 3.0]'. Returns null if s is null or empty.
